maml:description.maml:para: Connects to a Habitica account and securely stores authentication data in a SecretVault.

This function authenticates a user against Habitica's API using username and password. Once authenticated, it stores the User ID, API Token, and Client identifier in a SecretVault ("PSHabitica"), allowing subsequent API calls to authenticate without reentering credentials.
The x-client attribute. Required by Habitica API. Format: <username>-<appname>. Refer to: https://github.com/HabitRPG/habitica/wiki/API-Usage-Guidelines#x-client-header
The Habitica username (email address or handle). Required for first authentication.
The Habitica account password, passed as a SecureString.
The x-client attribute. Required by Habitica API. Format: <username>-<appname>. Refer to: https://github.com/HabitRPG/habitica/wiki/API-Usage-Guidelines#x-client-header
The Habitica username (email address or handle). Required for first authentication.
The Habitica account password, passed as a SecureString.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Rodrigo Cordeiro Module: PSHabitica This function registers the SecretVault "PSHabitica" automatically if not present.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to Habitica and stores the authentication data in the SecretVault.
Connects with plain text converted to SecureString.
Uses Windows Credential Manager prompt to obtain the SecureString password.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the current user's tags from Habitica.
Calls the Habitica API to return the list of tags defined by the user. Tags can be used to group tasks like todos, dailies, or habits.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all tags for the authenticated Habitica user.
Lists the names of all tags.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new tag in Habitica.
Calls the Habitica API to create a new tag associated with the authenticated user.
The name of the tag to create.
The name of the tag to create.
Creates a new Habitica task (Todo, Daily, or Habit).

This function allows you to create tasks in Habitica via its API. It supports all available task types (todo, daily, habit), and exposes the main fields such as text, notes, tags, priority, recurrence, checklist items, and habit up/down directions.
The type of the task. Valid values are: "todo", "daily", "habit".
The title or name of the task.
A custom string identifier for the task (unique within your account).
An optional description or additional details for the task.
A list of tag IDs or names to associate with the task.
Task difficulty. Valid values are: 0.1 = Trivial, 1 = Easy, 1.5 = Medium, 2 = Hard. (Default is 1).
Which attribute this task affects. Valid values are: "str", "int", "con", "per". (Default is "str").
An array of checklist item texts to include in the task.
(For todos only) Due date of the task.
The type of the task. Valid values are: "todo", "daily", "habit".
The title or name of the task.
A custom string identifier for the task (unique within your account).
An optional description or additional details for the task.
A list of tag IDs or names to associate with the task.
Task difficulty. Valid values are: 0.1 = Trivial, 1 = Easy, 1.5 = Medium, 2 = Hard. (Default is 1).
Which attribute this task affects. Valid values are: "str", "int", "con", "per". (Default is "str").
An array of checklist item texts to include in the task.
(For dailies only) Recurrence type. Valid values: "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "yearly".
(For dailies only) Days of the week to repeat. Example: @(1,3,5).
(For dailies only) Which weeks of the month the daily should repeat.
(For dailies only) Specific days of the month to repeat.
The type of the task. Valid values are: "todo", "daily", "habit".
The title or name of the task.
A custom string identifier for the task (unique within your account).
An optional description or additional details for the task.
A list of tag IDs or names to associate with the task.
Task difficulty. Valid values are: 0.1 = Trivial, 1 = Easy, 1.5 = Medium, 2 = Hard. (Default is 1).
Which attribute this task affects. Valid values are: "str", "int", "con", "per". (Default is "str").
An array of checklist item texts to include in the task.
(For habits only) Whether the habit can be scored "up" (positive).
(For habits only) Whether the habit can be scored "down" (negative).
The type of the task. Valid values are: "todo", "daily", "habit".
The title or name of the task.
A custom string identifier for the task (unique within your account).
An optional description or additional details for the task.
A list of tag IDs or names to associate with the task.
Task difficulty. Valid values are: 0.1 = Trivial, 1 = Easy, 1.5 = Medium, 2 = Hard. (Default is 1).
Which attribute this task affects. Valid values are: "str", "int", "con", "per". (Default is "str").
An array of checklist item texts to include in the task.
(For todos only) Due date of the task.
(For dailies only) Recurrence type. Valid values: "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "yearly".
(For dailies only) Days of the week to repeat. Example: @(1,3,5).
(For dailies only) Which weeks of the month the daily should repeat.
(For dailies only) Specific days of the month to repeat.
(For habits only) Whether the habit can be scored "up" (positive).
(For habits only) Whether the habit can be scored "down" (negative).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Todo task due in 3 days, with a checklist and tags.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXEMPLO 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-Task -Type daily -Text "Go for a run" -Frequency weekly `

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Daily that repeats every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday.
Creates a Habit that can only be scored positively.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a Habitica tag.
Calls the Habitica API to delete a tag by its ID.
The ID of the tag to delete.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The ID of the tag to delete.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Updates an existing Habitica tag.
Calls the Habitica API to update the name of an existing tag by its ID.
The ID of the tag to update.
The new name for the tag.
The ID of the tag to update.
The new name for the tag.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Finds the "Work" tag and renames it to "Office".
